column4: am i the only one who tries to use the 8800gt with the realtime kernel?
i use 8800GTS 512 with RT kernel...close
does one have to do any special magic to get the card to work with the realtime kernel specifically?
i did NOT have to do anything special ... I am using the nvidia drivers, if that matters
in my case i can start the generic and it works
but as soon as i start the realtime one i can only run in low graphics mode
wait i forgot..if you are using the nvidia drivers you must re-install them anytime the kernel changes
that is probably it - I had to check my blog to recall what I did and I made a note of the re-install of drivers
would you recommend using the "envy" script?
well, I HAVE used it in the past when I got so frustrated trying to do install the nvidia drivers manually. So, my experience is give it a good try first yourself, and then if that fails, try envy
usually when I have this problem it is because the "vesa" driver is being used. This means the "nvidia" driver was not installed.

did you re-install the drivers? since they are complied against the kernel headers, this must be done everytime the kernel changes....oh, nvm I mean the drivers from nvidia proper, not the ones from the restricted driver manager ... you will need to install the drivers from nvidia manually I think
envy did the job for the generic kernel
so why shouldn't it work with the realtime kernel?
I don't know enough about how envy works to guess. On this machine (which is x86_64 rt), I install the drivers myself after downloading from nvidia
you will have to download the drivers from nvidia and try to manually install. it can be a pain to get it working the first time
the thing is that i could use my older nvidia on both kernels
envy did the job for that card on both kernels
well give it a shot, maybe you will be lucky
gonna try
do you use the 169.12 driver?
didn't work?
hooray!
